marketNews.title: The Fed Lowers Interest Rate Cut Expectations
marketNews.content: The US central statistics bureau on Wednesday (12/6) reported that inflation eased again in May 2024 and was below expectations. Here are the details: MoM Inflation: 0.0% (vs. consensus: 0.1%; April 2024: 0.3%) YoY Inflation: 3.3% (vs. consensus: 3.4%; April 2024: 3.4%) Core MoM Inflation: 0.2% (vs. consensus: 0.3%; April 2024: 0.3%) Core YoY Inflation: 3.4% (vs. consensus: 3.5%; April 2024: 3.6%) Meanwhile, in a meeting that took place a few hours after the inflation data release, The Fed decided to maintain the interest rate at the level of 5.25-5.5%, in line with consensus expectations. The Fed also released the latest dot plot projection which indicates that interest rate cuts in 2024 will only occur by 25 bps or only 1 time, less than the previous projection which reached 75 bps or 3 times. According to The Fed, so far only modest progress has been seen towards achieving the inflation target of 2%. The developments above increased market participants' expectations for an interest rate cut in September 2024. According to analysis from CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of The Fed starting an interest rate cut in September 2024 rose to 62.4% from 52.8% before the inflation data release and the Fed meeting announcement. Following the release of inflation and the Fed meeting, here is the market data in the US on Wednesday (12/6): US dollar index (DXY) fell -0.59%. US stock exchanges generally reacted positively: S&P +0.85%, Nasdaq +1.53%, and DJIA -0.09%. 10-year US government bond yield fell -10 bps. Meanwhile, here is the market reaction in Indonesia on Thursday (13/6): The Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar closed stronger by +0.06% to the level of 16,286. IHSG fell by -0.27% to the level of 6,831. 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rose +6 bps to 7.08%.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The weak reaction in the Rupiah exchange rate, government bond yields, and IHSG in today's trading indicates that foreign investor interest in Indonesia has not returned. For Indonesia itself, we assess that Bank Indonesia can only start cutting interest rates if the Rupiah exchange rate strengthens convincingly. The consensus expects Bank Indonesia to start cutting interest rates in 4Q24. To mitigate volatility risk from interest rate uncertainty, investors can take advantage of opportunities to lock in high and attractive yields on FR bonds, especially short-term series such as FR0081 and PBS032. On the other hand, SBR013 can be used to mitigate high-interest rate risk because it has a floating with floor coupon. From the stock market, with valuations reaching cheap levels, this momentum can be utilized to accumulate quality stocks such as the Big 4 Banks, TLKM, and ASII.

marketNews.title: Investment Target for 2025 Amid Global Uncertainty
marketNews.content: Minister of Investment, Bahlil Lahadalia, said that the government targets investment realization in 2025 to reach IDR 1,850-1,900 trillion, an increase of +12.1-15.2% from the 2024 target of IDR 1,650 trillion. Responding to this, the Director of Digital Economy from the Center of Economics and Law Studies, Nailul Huda, said that the target is unfounded given the uncertain global conditions. The Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs estimates that around 80 million jobs will be lost due to the development of technological digitalization. On the other hand, 67 million new jobs requiring digital skills will emerge.

marketNews.title: EV Battery Surplus and Nickel Usage Forecast Adjustment
marketNews.content: Research from BloombergNEF estimates that global electric vehicle batteries will experience a surplus of up to 5x by the end of 2025, driven by the global factory construction trend. China is projected to experience the most acute oversupply, with an electric vehicle battery surplus of up to 400% within the next decade. Furthermore, BloombergNEF also cut its projection for nickel usage in EV batteries in 2025 by -25% due to the increasing popularity of lithium ferro phosphate (LFP) based batteries, especially among Chinese manufacturers.

marketNews.title: Motorcycle Sales Data for May 2024
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales in May 2024 reached 505,670 units (-4.5% YoY, +20.6% MoM). Cumulatively during 5M24, domestic motorcycle sales reached 2.66 million units (-1.8% YoY), equivalent to 40.9-42.9% of the 2024 target set by AISI at 6.2-6.5 million units. The Head of Commercial Field for AISI, Sigit Kumala, said that the trend of motorcycle sales in Indonesia is still quite positive amidst the declining purchasing power of the community.

marketNews.title: GIIAS 2024 Hopes to Support Car Sales
marketNews.content: The Third Chairman of Gaikindo, Rizwan Alamsjah, said that his party hopes the Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show (GIIAS) 2024 event next July can support car sales. In the exhibition, Rizwan mentioned that there will be 55 brands participating, with 40 new vehicle models. During 5M24, wholesale car sales in Indonesia only reached 334,897 units (-21% YoY), fulfilling only 30.4% of the 2024 target set by Gaikindo at 1.1 million units.

marketNews.title: Nickel Mining Company CNI Plans IPO in 1H25 and Smelter Operations
marketNews.content: Kontan reports that the nickel mining company, PT Ceria Nugraha Indotama (CNI), plans an IPO on the IDX in 1H25. CNI's President Director, Derian Sakmiwata, said that his party will start operating the RKEF smelter worth IDR 5 trillion in 2024, with an annual production capacity of 13 thousand tons of ferronickel. In addition, CNI is also mentioned to plan the construction of an HPAL smelter with a capacity of 146.6 thousand MHP per year at a cost of IDR 30 trillion. Derian mentioned that Glencore Plc. will purchase all products generated by the HPAL smelter.

tickerNews.title: BRPT Plans to Distribute 185.4 Million Treasury Shares as Bonus and MESOP
tickerNews.content: BRPT: Barito Pacific plans to distribute 185.4 million treasury shares with details of 150 million through bonus share distribution and 35.4 million through the MESOP program. Bonus shares will be distributed with a ratio of 625:1. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is June 26, 2024, with bonus share distribution on July 19, 2024. After this transaction, the number of BRPT treasury shares will decrease to 0.

tickerNews.title: HRUM Targets Limonite Nickel Ore Production and Updates on Smelter Operations
tickerNews.content: HRUM: The President Director of Harum Energy, Ray A. Gunara, said that his party targets a limonite nickel ore production of 500 thousand-1 million tons in 2024. Meanwhile, NPI production is targeted to grow +204-257% to 23.8 thousand-28 thousand tons, following the consolidation of PT Infei Metal Industry in September 2023. HRUM also targets nickel matte production of 38 thousand-42 thousand tons following the commencement of operations of PT Westrong Metal Industry as of March 2024. Ray also mentioned that the HPAL smelter with a capacity of 67 thousand MHP per year owned by the subsidiary, PT Blue Sparking Energy, will begin operating in 1Q26.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Grew +21% YoY in May 2024 Driven by Consolidation
tickerNews.content: INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded cement sales volume growth of +21% YoY in May 2024, with total market share rising to 29.3% (vs. May 2023: 27%) due to the consolidation of Semen Grobogan. This result was driven by growth in Java Island (+25% YoY), with market share increasing to 37% (vs. May 2023: 33.4%). Meanwhile, sales volume outside Java Island grew +14.4% YoY, with market share rising to 20.5% (vs. May 2023: 19.7%). National cement industry sales volume rose +11.5% YoY in May 2024.

tickerNews.title: UNVR Sells Production Machinery Assets to Affiliate, Unilever Thailand
tickerNews.content: UNVR: Unilever Indonesia sold production machinery assets for certain cream types and related equipment to its affiliate, Unilever Thailand. The total transaction value reached 3.3 million Euros. This sale is expected to have a positive effect for the company as it can refocus on producing core products from the ice cream business line.

tickerNews.title: MYOR Targets 2024 Net Profit Growth of +7.2% YoY with IDR 1.5 Trillion Capex
tickerNews.content: MYOR: The Director of Mayora Indah, Wardhana Atmadja, said that his party targets net profit growth in 2024 of +7.2% YoY to IDR 3.47 trillion, with a sales target growing +8.9% YoY to IDR 34.28 trillion. To achieve this target, MYOR allocated Capex of IDR 1.5 trillion, intended for factory construction in Pasuruan and maintenance. During 4M24 alone, Wardhana said that MYOR's net profit grew +49.4% YoY to IDR 1.2 trillion, with sales rising +5.8% YoY to IDR 10.83 trillion.

tickerNews.title: TPMA Adds 1 New Tug Boat and Targets +10-20% YoY Growth in 2024 Revenue and Net Profit
tickerNews.content: TPMA: The Director of Trans Power Marine, Rudy Sutiono, said that his party has added 1 new tug boat from the target addition of 9 vessels in 2024. With this fleet addition, TPMA currently operates 40 tug boats, 35 barges, and 3 floating cranes to serve the demand for bulk commodity transportation services, including coal. In 2024, TPMA allocated Capex of USD 20 million to purchase 2 additional tug boats, 6 barges, and 1 floating crane. Revenue and net profit in 2024 are targeted to grow around +10-20% YoY.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Controller PT Paraga Artamida Increases Stake to 40.1%
tickerNews.content: BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai controller, PT Paraga Artamida, purchased ~18.6 million BSDE shares at an average price of ~IDR 942.43 per share from June 5-11, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~IDR 17.5 billion. After this transaction, PT Paraga Artamida's ownership in BSDE increased from 40% to 40.1%.

tickerNews.title: CUAN Commissioner Erwin Ciputra Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: CUAN: The President Commissioner of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN), Erwin Ciputra, purchased 150 thousand CUAN shares at an average price of IDR 8,121 per share on June 10, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~IDR 1.22 billion. After this transaction, Erwin Ciputra's ownership in CUAN increased from 0.012% to 0.013%.
